intro: Byrsonima myricifolia f. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular byrsonima, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its glandular-stipitate leaves, which have small, sticky glands along the petioles. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by oval, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its potential medicinal properties. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
